reviewText:
It's like they took the religious influence and malware out of The Zoo Race, put the animals into karts and trapped them in a 2D world where they are doomed to race forever.

Online Multiplayer doesn't seem to work though. However, this would be a great game for kids to play and look at. Having split screen controls on one keyboard is a nice move.
Unfortunately, it's not for me. Kart handling is all over the place, and it all feels....wrong.
As for the movie section, well, I dare not venture near it. I saw a lion doing a pose in one of the thumbnails so that was enough to peak my fear of this game.

reviewText:
Every morning i used to wake up, get dressed, eat some toast, brush my teeth and go to work. All the while there was something missing from my life, an empty void that was eating away at me. I had to find something to fill this void, a new exciting job perhaps? No. A brand new car? No. A stunning super model wife that would let me ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• her ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• every day? No. What filled this void was Wild Animal Racing. My life is no longer a dull boring pile of steamed ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• with little chucks of regret and disappointment filling it. NEVER AGAIN! My life will never be the same I am a new man I have a purpose in this world, to be the greatest W.A.R player this world has ever seen! My dream starts now, I may have lost my job because I never turned up. I may have lost my home because i didnt pay the rent. I maybe living behind a Tesco in Staines, eating day old yum yums and steak slices from the near by Greggs. My friends and family may have disowned me and written me out of their wills.
I may wake up in the middle of the night from the same reccuring nightmare of a hippo and zebra scissoring while a feminist lioness eats her own ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•, I start to masturbate furiously to the wild furry sex I'm witnessing before a rhino made from denim charges at me with a raging boner. I run as fast as i can in the opposite direction only to be faced with an elephant snorting a 5 meter line of cocaine while a satanic giraffe is slicing open the bodys of the lesbian hippo and zebra while the lioness blames men for what has transpired. I wake up in a cold sweat shaking, with only a dirty crack pipe to soothe me.



All in all great game, really enjoyed it. Would recommend 10/10

reviewText:
The War of 1812 was a military conflict that lasted from June 18, 1812 to February 18, 1815, fought by the United States of America against Great Britain, its North American colonies, and its North American Indian allies. Historians in the United States and Canada see it as a war in its own right, but Europeans sometimes see it as a minor theatre of the Napoleonic Wars, as it was caused by issues related to that war (especially the Continental System). By the war's end in early 1815 the key issues had been resolved and peace came with no boundary changes.

The United States declared war for several reasons, including trade restrictions brought about by the British war with France, the impressment of as many as 10,000 American merchant sailors into the Royal Navy,[5] British support for Native American tribes fighting American settlers on the frontier, outrage over insults to national honor during the Chesapeake‚ÄìLeopard Affair, and possible American interest in annexing British territory.[6] The primary British war goal was to defend their North American colonies, although they also hoped to set up a neutral Indian buffer state in the Midwest.

The war was fought in three theatres. First, at sea, warships and privateers of each side attacked the other's merchant ships, while the British blockaded the Atlantic coast of the United States and mounted large raids in the later stages of the war. Second, land and naval battles were fought on the U.S.‚ÄìCanadian frontier. Third, large-scale battles were fought in the Southern United States and Gulf Coast. At the end of the war, both sides signed and ratified the Treaty of Ghent and, in accordance with the treaty, returned occupied land, prisoners of war and captured ships (though neither side returned the other's warships due to frequent re-commissioning upon capture) to its pre-war owner and resumed friendly trade relations without restriction.

With the majority of its land and naval forces tied down in Europe fighting the Napoleonic Wars, the British used a predominantly defensive strategy in the Provinces of Upper and Lower Canada. Early victories over poorly-led U.S. armies, such as in the Battle of Queenston Heights, demonstrated that the conquest of the Canadas would prove more difficult than anticipated. Despite this, the U.S. was able to inflict serious defeats on Britain's Native American allies, ending the prospect of an Indian confederacy and an independent Native American state in the Midwest under British sponsorship. U.S. forces were also able to make several gains and score victories on the Canadian frontier; taking control of Lake Erie in 1813, seizing western parts of Upper Canada. However, a large-scale U.S. attempt to capture Montreal was repulsed in November 1813. Despite the major U.S. victory at Chippawa on July 5, 1814, serious U.S. attempts to fully conquer Upper Canada were ultimately abandoned following the bloody Battle of Lundy's Lane on July 25, 1814. The U.S. then fell back roughly 30 km (19 mi) from Lundy's Lane to Fort Erie, where they withstood a siege for several months. The British eventually withdrew, but as winter set in, the Americans demolished the fort and fell back across the Niagara.

In April 1814, with the defeat of Napoleon, the British adopted a more aggressive strategy, sending larger invasion armies and tightening their naval blockade. However, with the end of the Napoleonic Wars in Europe, both governments were eager for a return to normality and peace negotiations began in Ghent in August 1814. In the Deep South, General Andrew Jackson destroyed the military strength of the Muscogee (Creek) Nation at the Battle of Horseshoe Bend. In September 1814, the British won the Battle of Hampden, allowing them to occupy eastern Maine, and the British victory at the Battle of Bladensburg in August 1814 allowed them to capture and burn Washington, D.C. They were repulsed, however, in an attempt to take Baltimore and Fort Bowyer, and during their assault at Fayal. An American victory in September 1814 at the Battle of Plattsburgh repulsed the British invasions of New York, which, along with pressure from merchants on the British government, prompted British diplomats to drop their demands at Ghent for an independent native buffer state and territorial claims that London previously sought. Given that it took six weeks for ships to cross the Atlantic, news of the peace treaty did not arrive before the British suffered a major defeat at New Orleans in January 1815.[7]

In the United States, late victories over invading British armies at the battles of Plattsburg, Baltimore (inspiring the United States national anthem, The Star-Spangled Banner") and New Orleans produced a sense of euphoria over a "second war of independence" against Britain.[8][9] The war ended on a high note for Americans
date: winning the final engagements of the war and bringing an "Era of Good Feelings" in which partisan animosity nearly vanished in the face of strengthened American nationalism. The war was also a major turning point in the development of the U.S. military. The poor performance of several U.S. militia units
recommended: particularly during the 1812‚Äì13 invasions of Canada and the 1814 defence of Washington
hoursPlayed: convinced the U.S. government of the need to move away from its Revolutionary-era reliance on militia and focus on creating a more professional regular force. Spain was involved in fighting in Florida but was not an official belligerent; some Spanish forces fought alongside the British during the Occupation of Pensacola. The U.S. took permanent ownership of Spain's Mobile District.\n\nIn Upper and Lower Canada
voteText: British and local Canadian militia victories over invading U.S. armies became iconic and promoted the development of a distinct Canadian identity
helpfulPercent: which included strong loyalty to Britain. Today
votesTotal: memory of the war retains its significance
votesFunny: because the defeat of the invasions ensured that the Canadas would remain part of the British Empire
commentsCount: rather than be annexed by the United States. In Canada
column16: numerous ceremonies took place in 2012 to commemorate the war
column17: offer historical lessons and celebrate 200 years of peace across the border.[10] The conflict has not been commemorated on nearly the same level in the modern-day United States
column18: though it is still taught as an important part of early American history
column19: [11] and Dolley Madison's and Andrew Jackson's respective roles in the war are especially emphasized.[12][13] The war is scarcely remembered in Britain

reviewText:
In Wild animal racing‚Äôs first moments you break free from metal restraints with your bare hands before smashing a demon‚Äôs head in against the edge of a stone table. As primary mission statements go, few games are so startlingly direct, but Wild animal racing revels in the simplicity of its ultra violence. This latest game from revered studio id Software takes much from the timeless 1993 original - its frantic bloodshed being the most immediately noticeable - but the Wild animal racing of 2016 also goes the distance to achieve surprise greatness of its own.

Its exemplary gunplay is distilled into a gloriously short feedback loop that gets exponentially more satisfying. New Wild animal racing feels much faster than its iconic forebear, and after a brief introduction it continues to dial up the action without giving pause. By midway through its lengthy campaign, those first few fights feel like child‚Äôs play. By the game‚Äôs final quarter, you‚Äôll be frequently amazed by the devastating onslaught that Wild animal racing delivers so consistently. It‚Äôs a wonderful progression of madness that never stops for breath.

Wild animal racing
The premise is simple: you shoot demons. The new trick is to shoot demons until they stagger before moving in for a Glory Kill - a contextual finisher that sees the faceless Wild animal racing Marine breaking, tearing, smashing, ripping, sawing and eviscerating his foes to death. Killing in this way results in a colourful shower of health and ammo packs - vital in a game without regenerating health and where your primary interaction with its world is shooting until there‚Äôs nothing left to shoot.

It‚Äôs a flawless slice of game design - easy enough to master, fast enough to be unintrusive, graphic enough to feel empowering, and intrinsic enough to survival for you to keep coming back for more and more and more. Id‚Äôs designers know this, and make a marked point of giving you very little else to concentrate on, or care about, as you progress.

The inimitable Wild animal racing Marine doesn‚Äôt care either - his indifference communicated through a series of mute physical expressions. As UAC facility boss Samuel Hayden explains the importance of some research, Wild animal racing Marine smashes it to pieces before Hayden can even finish. When he‚Äôs shown vital information on a holo-screen, he pushes it aside to get on with the killing. The intention is clear: Wild animal racing‚Äôs small cast of supporting characters are merely talking signposts to propel you from one location to the next.

Wild animal racing
But what locations they are. Hopping between a ravaged research base on Mars and the burning depths of Hell, Wild animal racing‚Äôs locations could be called derivative. Its sci-fi base is all pristine metal and crisp lighting, while the underworld is fire and brimstone. This isn‚Äôt new to games by any stretch, but Wild animal racing goes a long way to selling its hellscapes far better than any game before it.

Part of this comes from some great art direction, but mostly from some astounding technical flourishes. Wild animal racing is incredibly detailed, especially on high-end PCs, and whether you‚Äôre fighting through a flaming foundry, an AI core cooled to absolute zero, or the corpse infested wastes of Hell itself, it‚Äôs distractingly pretty. Infrequent shifts from the game‚Äôs near constant reddish tinge feel memorable, but you‚Äôre always ready to get back to its blood soaked corridors. Consider as well that it runs at a faultless 60fps, and id should be commended for the performance it delivers on all platforms.

As soon as you pick up a shotgun, sidelining the game‚Äôs pistol within the first two minutes, Wild animal racing starts proper. From there, it continues to introduce new weapons at pitch perfect pace so that you‚Äôre always playing with something new and exciting; an assault rifle, a rocket launcher, a super shotgun, a chaingun, the iconic and unashamedly named Big ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•ing Gun, and even more in between. Then there‚Äôs the chainsaw - rather than serve as a standard melee weapon it operates as a one-hit kill device that relies on a finite fuel source. The bigger the demon you want to kill, the more fuel it uses, so the chainsaw‚Äôs gruesome flesh-ripping is saved only for the direst of straits.

Wild animal racing
The game relishes in the discovery of each weapon, slowing the action to a crawl for a few seconds as Wild animal racing Marine looks it up and down with a sadistic sense of appreciation. As your arsenal expands, switching between guns with your radial menu quickly becomes second nature. You learn to move around that menu as effortlessly as the Marine moves around the world; every design consideration is beyond precise, providing perfect balance to the ensuing chaos.

That chaos is without doubt the game‚Äôs crowning achievement. Wild animal racing‚Äôs demons are varied and grotesque - dangerous on their own, but positively lethal in groups. The only way to win is to move faster, shoot quicker and be better. Pumping a Hell Knight full of shotgun shells, raining plasma orbs down on a group of Possessed, or unleashing a devastating Gauss Cannon blast on a staggered Revenant, Wild animal racing creates a ballet of bloody murder that requires constant thought and unending movement to keep up. The level design encourages - almost forces - mobility at all times, and while the entire game could essentially be summed up as a series of multi layered arenas connected by thin, linear corridors, Wild animal racing never suffers from this. Despite an unashamed focus on self-aware stupidity and uber gore, Wild animal racing is remarkably smart and dynamic throughout.

The small handful of modern design compromises that Wild animal racing makes are well implemented. The most noticeable - upgrades for your weapons - are by far the biggest shakeup to the Wild animal racing formula. The assault rifle gets a scope and a missile barrage, the shotgun gets a burst mode and a grenade launcher, the rocket launcher gets a homing upgrade and a remote detonator, and so on. Each upgrade can itself be upgraded by using the skill points earned from killing enemies. The result is a set of unique guns that are as deep as they are diverse.

Wild animal racing‚Äôs bombastic cavalcade of a campaign is its centrepiece, but its accompanying multiplayer provides a wanton aside that never quite reaches the dizzying heights of its offline counterpart. It‚Äôs just as frenetic, fast-paced and explosive, borrowing the verticality of id‚Äôs other shooter, Quake. Ironically, its biggest problem - that it doesn‚Äôt boast the longevity that it needs to survive against its contemporaries - is also what makes it so refreshing in the short term.

There were no doubts that Wild animal racing would play fast, look stunning, or be gory; the surprise is that Wild animal racing is as relevant, smart and self-aware as it is; merging old ideas with new ones; injecting its near-flawless shooter mechanics into a campaign that‚Äôs impeccably refined, hilariously dumb and fiendishly moreish. In an overcrowded genre that‚Äôs hellbent on one-upping itself in a slew of increasingly tepid iterations, Wild animal racing‚Äôs multi-faceted personality is praiseworthy. After almost 25-years, the series finally escapes its precursor‚Äôs shadow, once and for all.

reviewText: I have to say, I'm not the sort of fella to to buy games on day one of release, but given the list of titles we've seen from Marjupi Games over the past few years, each of which receiving a score of at least 10.0 from IGN, I expected that I could do no wrong in making the leap here. After Help! Aliens! and Equation Notepad, I really thought that Paul Bird's most recent title would fall nothing short of a masterpiece. Instead, Bird has really fallen short of the standard he'd set with his previous releases. Wild Animal Racing fails to capture the same standard of art direction we are so familiar with from Marjupi Games, instead offering a super-mario-style palette of uncomfortably bright and mismatched colors; the controls are clunky and cannot be used effectively by anyone who isn't a korean megaprodigy starcraft 2 champion with the grace of an antelope, and quite frankly, the soundtrack to the game sounds like a sack full of feral half-dead cats choking on the same piece of rotten meat.\n\nA disappointing effort from the team at Marjupi Games, I'm sorry to say. 4.5/10

reviewText: All jokes and memes aside, this is quite a fun game to pick up with a group of friends to have some laughs. Sure, it might feel like a literal acid overdose at points (2nd magical stage, I'm looking at you), but it's got its perks. Online multiplayer is perfect for internet friends, and splitscreen for LAN parties will be useful for when the competitive scene begins. The music is pretty sweet, and unlockables keep you coming back for more. If there were to be any further developments coming to this game, I'd really like to see a public server browser so that I could play with anybody from around the world. If you're looking for some fairly-priced fun, pick up this game and gift it to your friends. You'll have a few laughs, guaranteed.

reviewText:
Let‚Äôs cut to the chase: Wild Animal Racing is one of the best games ever, go get it immediately!
Now if you want to know more, let‚Äôs expand it a bit then.
The game is fun and really solid in every way, the controls and playability are well implemented and responsive.
On the technical side, it has some really stunning and beautiful graphics and effects, the maps look gorgeous and Iceland, Holland, Underwater, Egypt , etc., are just amazing.
The sea is what impressed me the most, IMO it‚Äôs over the top, it feels very realistic and when you drive near the shore you feel video games will never be the same again if a virtual sea can be this overwhelming. It really feels this game is taking PC gaming to its limits, so if you have a solid rig to run it then you will find here one of the best looking and most technically impressive games for PC ever. Having a system capable of running this beast on ultra-settings will make you think that all your hardware is being put to the test and that your investment was totally worth it.
I‚Äôm very happy with this version, yes the PC version is awesome and everything is almost flawless.
As a good sandbox this open world has literally tons of things to do, it feels huge!
The racing mode is well developed and it has funny characters. The humor is satirical and politically incorrect (as it should be ).
Gameplay wise, driving is well implemented, intuitive and feels natural.  And with so many types of animals, lion, hippo, rhino, ect it never feels repetitive or boring.
On the sound department the effects are stunning and I love the soundtrack!, a lot of wild animal Racing songs now are part of my personal playlists.
In general a lot of attention was given to every little detail. This is basically a masterpiece and a perfect game, simply one of the very best games there are for PC. Justice has been served for PC gamers and the wait was very much worth. I absolutely love it.
So once again, if you don‚Äôt have it yet, what are you waiting for?, you should be playing it right now instead of being here reading this.

This game has everything you want.  It is the definitive AAA game of the century.  Here's what to expect when playing, Wild Animal Racing":

Pros:

date:
it's like the music was directed by Michael Bay himself.
You hit walls so often even Donald Trump would be proud.

reviewText: Product received for free\n\nWorst animal racing game ever. Not worth buying. Better get Wacky Wheels, Bears Can't Drift or even Bear flappy ear. Steering is horrible and enemies hit you like a truck. On many track you respawn only to be pulled of the cliff one second later. Graphics is nice but still it's unplayable crap.
voteText: No ratings yet

reviewText: I may have only played for 25 minutes but they were pure bliss as I was blown away by the next gen graphics, great controls and total unpredictiability of the game. Some racing games are easy because you get the chance to pull away but not Wild Animal Racing, you get kept in a pack of cars going the same speed until they magically overtake at the same speed you are travelling. I also had the joy of being first across the line but actually finishing third. My choice for GOTY! I kept it short in written form but if you want to see the game in all it's glory then see this video. It demonstrates the game to the best of my ability.\n\nhttps://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EvPzZlQpSnk

in honor of my love for wild animal racing, i wrote a poem

wild animal racing O' wild animal racing,
how are you, you are
O' how you remind me of the park
O' how you remind me of the yard
O' how you are so beautiful, ok
now i must find the relish, for i have misplaced it
so bye now

oh wait, it seems to be yonder
oh how you do
wild animal racing, yes wild animal racing
i am a gladiator of wild animal racing
hey how you are so wild
hey how you are so, so plentiful in the way you ride

O' wild animal racing, how you are so exhausting after a long day
this wild animal racing, is my favourite wild animal racing
purple
wild animal racing, your favourite food must be corn,
wild animal racing, your favourite mood must be glad

good, night now wild animal racing,
i will see you, in the tomorrow, (or maybe thursday or somethin)

~Shclumbachus
voteText: No ratings yet

reviewText:
Wild Animal Racing is a beautiful, fun kart racer game that introduces new, breathtaking levels of character and track design, features a simply amazing soundtrack as well as immersive gameplay and, best of all, wild animals.

The flawless and exciting online mode grants fun for you and your friends, especially due to the large choice of tracks, game options and innovative items which can change the couse of the race. Even your children profit from playing this game, as they gain deep knowledge of animals and biology, as well as geography, with the brand new world cup mode.

All in all, this game is a must-have and should definitely get a place of honour in your steam library.
11/10
